alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; Kershaw; Lee; Richland; Southern Lancaster; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 8:22PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Fairfield, southwestern Lancaster, Lee, southeastern Chesterfield, northwestern Sumter, northeastern Richland and Kershaw Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 822 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dovesville to near Cassatt to near Lake Wateree State Park to near Blackstock. Movement was south at 15 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Wateree Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Camden, Winnsboro, Bishopville, Lake Wateree Dam, Lugoff, Fairfield County Airport, Villages at Sandhill, Cassatt, Elliott, Elgin, Lee State Park, Lake Carolina, Longtown, Goodale State Park, Lake Wateree State Park, Killian, Blythewood, Bethune, Ridgeway and Lucknow. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 80 and 126. Interstate 77 between mile markers 23 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
